discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
HR Implementation ebook page 37: By default, the Caller Access field for all HR tables is set to Caller Restriction.

questions.question_text:
Scenario: An existing ITSM customer is now implementing HR Enterprise. As part of the implementation, the Scoped Application Restricted Caller Access [com.glide.scope.access.restricted_caller] plugin was automatically activated.
By default, what is the Caller Access field set to?
Which of the following is the key factor in determining the implementation timeline?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
HR Implementation ebook page 197

Selected Answer: A
From the implementation training book:
"Configuration complexity is the key factor when developing an implementation timeline"

Selected Answer: A
A is correct answer

Selected Answer: A
A , HRSD Implementation ebook, Page 35

Selected Answer: A
A seems logical

questions.question_text: Beginning with the Orlando release, which module allows HR Administrators to define which groups may access the various COEs or HR Services without needing to edit or create new ACL records?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
HR Implementation ebook page 151: The COE Security Configuration module allows admins to restrict access to all cases on a COE or to specific HR Services without creating ACL records.

questions.question_text:
A customer using Lifecycle Events Enterprise has documented a large offboarding Lifecycle Event that includes many steps. Many of the steps, including approvals, must be completed in a specific order.
Which of these is the best method to use to ensure the activities are triggered in the appropriate order?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Configure a lifecycle event activity that is a container for a group of activities. This activity type enables you to manage the dependencies of activities within an activity set. You can use activity containers to order activities, in parallel or sequence, as well as configure multiple activity containers within an activity set.

choices.B: Create separate trigger conditions for each of the dependent activities
choices.D: Create separate activity sets for each of the dependent activities
choices.C: Create activity containers for the dependent items
choices.A: Create a new lifecycle event for each of the dependent items

questions.question_text: What kinds of records can be created using HR Service Activities? (Choose two.)
